case_vignette: A 23-year-old woman is brought to the physician by her father because of irritability, mood swings, and difficulty sleeping over the past 10 days. A few days ago, she quit her job and spent all of her savings on supplies for a “genius business plan.” She has been energetic despite sleeping only 1–2 hours each night. She was diagnosed with major depressive disorder 2 years ago. Mental status examination shows pressured speech, a labile affect, and flight of ideas. Throughout the examination, she repeatedly states “I feel great, I don't need to be here.” Urine toxicology screening is negative.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling really irritable, having mood swings, and I'm having trouble sleeping lately.
Is this associated with any menstrual cycle changes? (For females)
My symptoms haven't been mentioned in relation to any menstrual cycle changes.
Have you recently experienced any significant stressors or life changes?
I recently quit my job and spent all my savings on supplies for a business idea I had.

Have you noticed any changes in appetite or weight?

(If yes: "Is there any weight loss or gain?")
(If no: "Are there any gastrointestinal symptoms such as abdominal pain, bloating, or diarrhea?")
No changes in appetite or weight were mentioned.

Do you have any history of mental health conditions or a family history of mental health issues?

(If yes: "What specific conditions?")
(If no: "Have you noticed any chest pain, shortness of breath, or palpitations?")
I was diagnosed with major depressive disorder 2 years ago.
Final Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) with recent exacerbation.
